result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

02:35 PM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA:  Erica Ellenwood, DF: Scotty Joe Sandlin appeared from jail, pro se. Set for PH. Court reviews file, DE qualifies for public defender but one has not yet been assigned. Court reviews letter from public defender's office which indicates there is a conflict with staff attorneys. ADA Ellenwood requests preliminary hearing no later than tomorrow as deputy will be on vacation after tomorrow. Court finds good cause to extend time limits for preliminary hearing, if necessary. Court sets PH with Branch 2. Adjourned: 2:47 PM. kma  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Scotty Joe Sandlin
Current: HOMELESS,   (Effective: 06-10-2022)
Prior: 208 Cloutier Dr., #5, Somerset, WI 54025
Filed by DA's Office. km
Identification Key. Filed by DA Anderson. km      to kap
Preliminary hearing on June 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

- If released from jail, I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to be fitted with a GPS monitoring device. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. 

If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, any juveniles, parks, schools or daycares.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-   I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing and random ETG testing at least TWO times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

- No access to internet.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:26 PM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA: Erica Ellenwood and Intern Connor Smith, DF ATTY: Abrianna Dolfi, DF: Scotty Joe Sandlin appeared from jail. DE qualifies for public defender. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Waives reading. State requests bond. Atty. Dolfi makes bond argument. Court sets bond. State may request bond amendment to include specific GPS restrictions. Court sets PH. Adjourned: 1:34 PM. kma  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
